## Notable papers
Ones that I indicated interest in on the spreadsheet, plus:

- [ ] [Learning to Poke by Poking: Experiential Learning of Intuitive Physics, Pulkit Agrawal*, Ashvin Nair*, Pieter Abbeel, Jitendra Malik, Sergey Levine](https://arxiv.org/abs/1606.07419)

- [ ] ["What happens if..." Learning to Predict the Effect of Forces in Images. Roozbeh Mottaghi, Mohammad Rastegari, Abhinav Gupta, Ali Farhadi. ECCV 2016.](https://arxiv.org/abs/1603.05600)

- [ ] [Visual Recognition with Humans in the Loop. S. Branson, C. Wah, B. Babenko, F. Schroff, P. Welinder, P. Perona and S. Belongie. ECCV 2010.](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/221304729_Visual_Recognition_with_Humans_in_the_Loop/download)

- [ ] [Matching Networks for One Shot Learning. Oriol Vinyals, Charles Blundell, Timothy Lillicrap, Koray Kavukcuoglu, Daan Wierstra. NIPS 2016](https://arxiv.org/abs/1606.04080)

- [ ] [Low-shot Learning from Imaginary Data. Yu-Xiong Wang, Ross Girshick, Martial Herbert, Bharath Hariharan. CVPR, 2018 (Spotlight).](https://arxiv.org/abs/1801.05401)

- [ ] [Curiosity-driven Exploration by Self-supervised Prediction. Deepak Pathak, Pulkit Agrawal, Alexei A. Efros and Trevor Darrell. International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML), 2017](https://arxiv.org/abs/1705.05363)

## Carl's papers
- [ ] [Cross-Modal Scene Networks Yusuf Aytar*, Lluis Castrejon*, Carl Vondrick, Hamed Pirsiavash, Antonio Torralba PAMI 2017](https://arxiv.org/abs/1610.09003)
- [ ] [Where are they Looking  Adri√† Recasens*, Aditya Khosla*, Carl Vondrick and Antonio Torralba](http://people.csail.mit.edu/khosla/papers/nips2015_recasens.pdf)
